senses.de: Fundamental, the core or essential part of something
senses.ex: He needs to learn the basic principles of science.

Tips.title: Underlying Necessity
Tips.description: Understand 'basic' means what is needed at the very least for understanding or functioning.
Tips.example: Learning to add and subtract is basic in math.

Tips.title: Not Optional
Tips.description: 'Basic' in this sense underlines something that cannot be skipped or ignored.

senses.de: Simple and not very sophisticated or advanced
senses.ex: This is a basic model with no advanced features.

Tips.title: Lacks Complexity
Tips.description: 'Basic' here implies the item or concept is straightforward and easy to understand.
Tips.example: That phone is pretty basic, it just calls and texts.

Tips.title: Starting Point
Tips.description: Signifies a good starting point for beginners due to its simplicity.
Tips.example: Start with a basic recipe if you're new to cooking.

senses.de: Belonging to the first or starting level of something
senses.ex: He has a basic understanding of the concept.

Tips.title: First Step
Tips.description: Emphasizes beginning at the most elementary level for newcomers.
Tips.example: His basic knowledge of French vocabulary helps him understand simple texts.

Tips.title: Foundation Layer
Tips.description: Highlights 'basic' as the essential foundation upon which more learning is built.
Tips.example: Master the basic chords before trying complex music pieces.

senses.de: In the field of chemistry, referring to a substance that can neutralize acids.

Tips.title: Scientific Context
Tips.description: Remember 'basic' in chemistry has a specific meaning related to pH levels.
Tips.example: The solution turned blue, indicating it was basic.

Tips.title: Not about Simplicity
Tips.description: 'Basic' in science doesn't refer to simplicity but to a property of substances that is measured.
Tips.example: If an acid is added to a basic liquid, it neutralizes it.

Elementary.wordDefinition:
Elementary has a similar meaning, but it usually refers to things that are more specifically related to a particular subject.

For example, you might take an elementary-level course in biology, which would cover the basic concepts and principles of biology.

Basic is a more general term that can apply to many different subjects or topics, while elementary is more specific and describes things that are specifically related to a particular subject.

Essential.wordDefinition:
Essential refers to something that is absolutely necessary or vital. It implies that something cannot proceed or exist without it.

For example, air, water, and food are essential for survival.

Basic refers to something that is fundamental or necessary to have a foundation on something, while essential refers to something that is absolutely necessary or vital for something to happen or exist.

Foundation.wordDefinition:
Foundation refers to the underlying support or basis upon which something is built or established.

For example, a strong foundation is necessary for a building to be stable and secure. In this sense, foundation implies a deeper, more comprehensive understanding or framework upon which further knowledge or skills can be built.

Basic refers to a minimum level of knowledge or skills, while foundation refers to a deeper understanding and framework for building upon that knowledge or skills.

Fundamental.wordDefinition:
Fundamental refers to something that is essential, necessary, or foundational. It implies that the thing in question is a key element that supports or underpins something else.

For example, the fundamental principles of mathematics are key to understanding complex theories in engineering or physics.

Basic refers to something simple or easy to understand, while fundamental refers to something essential or foundational.

Basic concepts are often learned first before moving onto more fundamental ideas.

Primary.wordDefinition:
Primary means the first or most important in a series or hierarchy. For example, primary education or primary sources.

Basic refers to the essential fundamentals of something, while primary refers to the most important or significant aspect of something.

Rudimentary.wordDefinition:
Rudimentary means something that is very basic or undeveloped, and often implies that the thing in question is not yet fully formed or functional.

For example, "rudimentary language skills" might refer to someone who can only speak a few basic words.

Both words can describe something that is simple or fundamental, but basic tends to imply a certain level of competence or proficiency, while rudimentary suggests a lack of sophistication or refinement.

Basic is more commonly used in everyday speech, while rudimentary is often used in more specialized contexts or in technical writing.

Simple.wordDefinition:
Basic means fundamental or essential, while the word simple means easy to understand or do. For example, a basic understanding of math is necessary to do well in school, while a simple recipe is easy to follow.

Basic refers to the underlying principles or foundation of something, while simple refers to the complexity or difficulty of a task.

Standard.wordDefinition:
Standard typically means a level of quality or excellence that is widely accepted or expected.

A standard can apply to a product, service or process.

It is something that is considered to be the norm or benchmark. For example, if a restaurant has high standards for food quality and customer service, they will likely have a reputation for being one of the best in their area.

Basic refers to something that is necessary or essential, while standard refers to a level of quality or excellence that is widely accepted or expected.

Undemanding.wordDefinition:
Basic means something that is essential or fundamental, while the word undemanding means something that is easy or not challenging.

Undemanding applies to things that do not require much effort or skill. For example, watching an undemanding movie is something that does not require much thought or attention.

Basic refers to something necessary or fundamental while undemanding refers to something that is easy or requires little effort.
